title: Strictly's Mike Bushell defended as he reveals online abuse for being saved
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Strictly’s Mike Bushell has said he’s trying to ‘rise above the abuse’ he’s received online after being saved on this week’s dance-off.

The BBC Breakfast presenter was met with a barrage of hate from livid fans who didn’t think he deserved to be saved after the dance-off.

Performing a tango to What You Waiting For? By Gwen Stefani, Mike had to compete with Catherine Tyldesley in the bottom two to keep his space.

Advertisement

It was a split decision with head judge Shirley Ballas ultimately keeping Mike in and sending Catherine home.

Responding on today’s BBC Breakfast, he said: ‘It’s an entertainment show, we’re all just trying our best.

‘I’ve said before, and this was the advice from Katya [Jones, his pro partner], I’m not really competing against anybody else, you’re competing against yourself to try and just learn to get better every week.

‘As a non-dancer myself that’s all I can really do.’

Mike said he was trying to rise above the hate he was getting online and keeping positive for the week ahead (Picture: BBC)

Talking about the hate he’s received, he added: ‘You have to rise about the abuse and people giving you abuse on social media, it’s one of the sad things about social media.’

He also added that he didn’t want to see Catherine and pro Johannes Radebe go, but he had to accept what decision was made.

The video was retweeted by fellow competitor Kelvin Fletcher, who wrote above it: ‘Honestly you won’t meet a nicer guy. What a class act.’

Will Bayley, who was absent from this week’s shows due to injury, added: ‘Love him.’

Mike and Katya landed in the dance off with their Alice in Wonderland themed routine (Picture: BBC)

It seems that Catherine and Johannes being let go was as much of a shock to the rest of the cast as it was to Mike and Katya – with Michelle saying her ‘jaw hit the ground’ over the decision.

‘I’m telling you if they’d kept the camera on me my jaw was on the ground,’ Michelle told Lorraine today.

‘I don’t know. It just goes to show you can’t rely on your favourite people, we rely on that. Giovanni and I are very grateful to everybody’s who’s been voting us though. I am having the time of my life!

‘Catherine and Johannes are two of my closest friends in this competition; so sad to see them go.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 7pm with the results show on Sunday at 7.15pm on BBC One.
